intro: Polygala polygama var. abortiva, commonly known as the abortive milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, bead-like fruits. This variety is notable for its limited distribution and is often found in specific ecological niches.
